decisions.name: Did not punch Al-Jilani
decisions.description: If you don't punch Al-Jilani during the interviews in Games 1, 2 or 3, you will be given a Paragon interrupt in Game 3 that results in Al-Jilani becoming a War Asset.

decisions.name: Recruited Dr. Chakwas
decisions.description: If you recruit Dr. Chakwas, Dr. Michel becomes a War Asset, and vice-versa.

decisions.name: Recruited Dr. Michel
decisions.description: If you recruit Dr. Michel, Dr. Chakwas becomes a War Asset, and vice-versa.

decisions.name: Pardoned Daniels and Donnelly
decisions.description: At the Spectre terminal, you can pardon Daniels and Donnelly, who are being held for their involvement with Cerberus in Game 2.

decisions.name: Eve survived to lead the krogan
decisions.description: Eve does not die during either [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka] or [megametracker://mission?id=A3.Bomb].

decisions.name: Genophage cured
decisions.description: The sabotage to the Shroud is uncovered in [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka], and Mordin (or Wiks) released the cure.

decisions.name: Mordin survived Tuchanka
decisions.description:
The requirements for saving Mordin in [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka] are: 
 - Reputation high enough. 
 - Keep the salarian sabotage secret. 
 - Wrex died. 
 - Maelon's data was destroyed.

decisions.name: Saved the Omega Civilians
decisions.description: Shepard took the time to reroute power from the mining reactor on Omega, and saved the civilians at risk.

decisions.name: Kissed Aria
decisions.description: Shepard pleased Aria during [megametracker://mission?id=DLC3.Omega2] and she kissed him/her at the end.

decisions.name: Ann Bryson was not harmed
decisions.description: When you are tracing Leviathan in [megametracker://mission?id=DLC3.Leviathan], you do not use the third Renegade interrupt and thereby harm Ann.

decisions.name: Paragon actions were taken for Ashley/Kaidan
decisions.description: Shepard took Paragon conversation options on [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Mars], and visited them in the hospital after they woke up.

decisions.name: Garrus wins the shooting match
decisions.description: "I'm Garrus Vakarian and this is now my favorite spot on the Citadel!"

decisions.name: EDI and Joker started a relationship
decisions.description: If encouraged by Shepard, EDI and Joker will become romatically involved.

decisions.name: Saved Bau
decisions.description: You save Bau during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.HanarDiplomat].

decisions.name: Saved Kahje
decisions.description: You save Kahje during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.HanarDiplomat].

decisions.name: Saved Grissom Academy
decisions.description: If you don't complete [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy] before [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], the students there will be taken by Cerberus. If Jack survived Game 2, she will also be taken and you will fight her as a phantom during [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.CerberusHQ].

decisions.name: Grissom Students sent into battle
decisions.description: After rescuing the students from [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy], Jack decides they are ready to join the war effort. In the final scenes of Game 3, Jack will be shown standing by their graves.

decisions.name: Rachni Queen spared
decisions.description: You saved the Rachni Queen or the Breeder in [megametracker://mission?id=A3.KroganTeam].

decisions.name: Ashley/Kaidan survived the coup
decisions.description:
These are the factors for saving Ashley/Kaidan during [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]: 
Penalties: 
 - Kirrahe and Thane died in prior games. 
 - Shepard cheated on Ashley/Kaidan in Game 2 and didn't apologize. 
 - Council died in Game 1. 
Bonuses: 
 - Shepard romanced Ashley/Kaidan in Game 1. 
 - Shepard was kind on Mars. 
 - Shepard visited them in the hospital. 
 - The Council was saved in Game 1. 
 - Shepard's squad lowers their weapons during the confrontation.

decisions.name: Samara lived
decisions.description: You stopped Samara from killing herself after [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ArdatYakshiMonastery].

decisions.name: Falere spared
decisions.description: You did not kill Falere after [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ArdatYakshiMonastery].

decisions.name: Gavin Archer committed suicide
decisions.description: If you rescued David from Cerberus in Game 2 but don't complete [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy] in Game 3 (or lie to Gavin and *say* David died), then when you speak to Gavin in [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ExCerberusScientists], he will leave and shoot himself.

decisions.name: Saved Riley
decisions.description: Engineer Lee Riley is saved in during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7FuelReactors].

decisions.name: Balak was spared
decisions.description: You manage to talk Balak down in [megametracker://mission?id=A3.BatarianCodes], and earn the batarians as a War Asset.

decisions.name: Set Conrad Verner straight
decisions.description:
Convince Conrad Verner to stop promoting Cerberus. 

If Shepard helps Conrad in Games 1, 2, and 3, Conrad will save Shepard's life in Game 3. His doctoral dissertation could also become a War Asset (see the four requirements here: [Reddit|https://www.reddit.com/r/masseffect/comments/1q8de2/dr_conrad_verner/]).

decisions.name: Rescued Legion
decisions.description: You finished the mission [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.GethDreadnought] and rescued Legion (must be Legion, not Geth VI). This is a key requirement for saving Tali's life.

decisions.name: Destroyed Reaper code infection
decisions.description: Completed the mission [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GethFighterSquadrons]. This is a key requirement for saving Tali's life.

decisions.name: Took down the geth jamming tower
decisions.description: You finished the mission [megametracker://mission?id=A3.AdmiralKoris]. This is important for saving Tali's life.

decisions.name: Saved Admiral Koris
decisions.description: Saved Koris at the expense of his men during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.AdmiralKoris]. Koris is a War Asset and additionally is a key requirement for saving Tali's life.

decisions.name: The quarians survived
decisions.description:
At the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch], you either stopped Legion and allowed all the geth to be killed, or fulfilled all the requirements to stop the quarian-geth war and thereby prevented Tali from killing herself. 
Those requirements are these four: 
 - Shepard has at least four bars of reputation.
 - Tali is still an admiral.
 - [megametracker://person?id=S2.Legion] is present.
 - [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GethFighterSquadrons] was completed. And 5 points from these:
 +2 Geth Heretics were destroyed in Game 2 
 +2 Rael'Zorah was not exposed during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.L.Tali].
 +1 The Tali/Legion was resolved equably.
 +1 You completed [megametracker://mission?id=A3.AdmiralKoris].
 +1 [megametracker://person?id=P2.Koris] was saved.

decisions.name: The geth were made intelligent
decisions.description: At the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch], you permit Legion to upload the modified Reaper code, giving the geth true intelligence. Without fulfilling all the requirements to save Tali, this action will result in the quarian fleet being destroyed and Tali killing herself.

decisions.name: Javik/Liara argument resolved amicably
decisions.description: Mediate this argument to alter what Javik decides to do with his life after the Reaper war.

decisions.name: Javik did not use memory shard
decisions.description: Prevent Javik from using the memory shard to alter what Javik decides to do with his life after the Reaper war.

decisions.name: Miranda survived Horizon
decisions.description:
The requirements to keep Miranda alive during [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Horizon]: 
 - Complete her Loyalty mission. 
 - Do not break up with her in Game 3. 
 - Meet her on the Citadel three times and give her Alliance resources and warn her about Kai Leng.

decisions.name: Brooks was incarcerated
decisions.description: Shepard does not kill Maya Brooks, but turns her over to the Systems Alliance for prosecution.

decisions.name: Romanced Ashley
decisions.description: Male Shepard only. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Steve
decisions.description: Male Shepard only. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Garrus
decisions.description: Female Shepard only. Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Traynor
decisions.description: Female Shepard only. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Kaidan
decisions.description: Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Liara
decisions.description: Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Miranda
decisions.description:
Some time after you warn Miranda about Kai Leng, she will invite you to her safehouse on the Citadel.

 Male Shepard only. Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Jack
decisions.description:
You can hook up at Purgatory after the events of Grissom Academy and [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2].

 Male Shepard only. Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Tali
decisions.description:
Call her up to your room before [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch].

 Male Shepard only. Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Provides a Paramour achievement. Only one Paramour partner is allowed.

decisions.name: Romanced Thane
decisions.description:
Available both in the hospital and at the end of Citadel DLC.

 Female Shepard only. Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Romanced Kelly
decisions.description:
After [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], speak to Kelly after each main mission. Before [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch], tell Kelly that *she* is your Significant Other.

 Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Romanced Samara
decisions.description:
Available at the end of Citadel DLC.

 Only allowed if character was romanced in Game 2. Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Romanced Allers
decisions.description:
Provide Allers with all three interviews, and after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch], invite her up to your cabin.

 Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Romanced Javik
decisions.description:
Available after the Citadel DLC party.

 Female Shepard only. Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Romanced Vega
decisions.description:
Available after the Citadel DLC party.

 Female Shepard only. Does not block subsequent romances. Does not provide the Paramour achievement.

decisions.name: Cortez survives Hammer landing
decisions.description: Speak to Cortez and help him deal with his grief, otherwise he dies during [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth], when his shuttle is shot and crashes.

decisions.name: Control Ending
decisions.description: Selected *Control* (Blue) at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth]. You will need a military score >1750 to select this option, >2350 to save Earth and Shepard's squad. Here's a breakdown with sample video: [IGN|https://www.ign.com/wikis/mass-effect-3/Endings].

decisions.name: Synthesis Ending
decisions.description: Selected *Synthesis* (Green) at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth]. You will need a military score >2800 to select this option, and Earth is saved and Shepard's squad is synthesized. Here's a breakdown with sample video: [IGN|https://www.ign.com/wikis/mass-effect-3/Endings].

decisions.name: Destroy Ending
decisions.description: Selected *Destroy* (Red) at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth]. You will need a military score >2050 to keep Earth from being vaporized, >2650 to save Earth and Shepard's squad, and >4000 to save Shepard. Here's a breakdown with sample video: [IGN|https://www.ign.com/wikis/mass-effect-3/Endings].

decisions.name: Refusal Ending
decisions.description: Refused to choose any of the options at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth]. The Reapers destroy everything.

decisions.name: Prejek Paddlefish Bonus
decisions.description: Keeping the Prejek Paddlefish alive throughout Game 3 and New Game+ results in an Intel Bonus from Liara after the Mars Mission (10% Weapon or Power Damage). It also becomes a War Asset.
